metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Once you have come up with a suitable name for your Django project, like mine: my_tennis_club , navigate to where in the file system you want to store the code (in the virtual environment), I will navigate to the myworld folder, and run this command in the command prompt:
content.html: Once you have come up with a suitable name for your Django project, like mine: my_tennis_club, navigate to where in the file system you want to store the code (in the virtual environment), I will navigate to the myworld folder, and run this command in the command prompt:

content.code_html: django-admin startproject my_tennis_club

content.text: Django creates a my_tennis_club folder on my computer, with this content:
content.html: Django creates a my_tennis_club folder on my computer, with this content:

content.code:
my_tennis_club

manage.py

my_tennis_club/

__init__.py

asgi.py

settings.py

urls.py

wsgi.py
content.code_html:
my_tennis_club
    manage.py
    my_tennis_club/
        __init__.py
        asgi.py
        settings.py
        urls.py
        wsgi.py

content.text: These are all files and folders with a specific meaning, you will learn about some of them later in this tutorial, but for now, it is more important to know that this is the location of your project, and that you can start building applications in it.
content.html: These are all files and folders with a specific meaning, you will learn about some of them later in this tutorial, but for now, it is more important to know that this is the location of your project, and that you can start building applications in it.

content.text: Now that you have a Django project, you can run it, and see what it looks like in a browser.
content.html: Now that you have a Django project, you can run it, and see what it looks like in a browser.

content.text: Navigate to the /my_tennis_club folder and execute this command in the command prompt:
content.html: Navigate to the /my_tennis_club folder and execute this command in the command prompt:

content.code_html: python manage.py runserver

content.text: Open a new browser window and type 127.0.0.1:8000 in the address bar.
content.html: Open a new browser window and type 127.0.0.1:8000 in the address bar.

content.text: The next step is to make an app in your project.
content.html: The next step is to make an app in your project.

content.text: You cannot have a web page created with Django without an app.
content.html: You cannot have a web page created with Django without an app.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct syntax for running a Django project?
content.html: What is a correct syntax for running a Django project?
